  "title": "IT Manager",
  "description": "Universal Human Resource (UHR) Consult Limited - Our client, a reputable Hotel, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The IT Manager is responsible for overseeing all technology operations in the hotel, ensuring reliable, secure, and efficient functioning of IT systems, networks, and software applications.
	The role involves managing the hotel&rsquo;s Property Management System (PMS), Point of Sale (POS) systems, internet and communication networks, and data security protocols.
	The IT Manager provides technical support to staff, ensures seamless guest connectivity, and drives digital transformation initiatives to enhance operational efficiency and guest experience.


Key Responsibilities
Systems &amp; Network Management:


	Oversee the installation, configuration, and maintenance of all IT infrastructure including servers, networks, routers, switches, and Wi-Fi systems.
	Ensure uninterrupted operation of hotel systems such as PMS, POS, accounting, and inventory management software.
	Monitor system performance and resolve any technical issues promptly to minimize downtime.
	Maintain backups and disaster recovery systems for critical data and applications.


Software &amp; Application Management:


	Administer and support all software applications used by the hotel (Opera, Micros, Sage, Zoho etc.).
	Ensure proper user access control, license management, and software updates.
	Collaborate with software vendors and service providers for maintenance, upgrades, and troubleshooting.


Data Security &amp; Compliance:


	Implement and enforce cybersecurity policies to protect hotel systems and guest data.
	Regularly update antivirus software, firewalls, and system patches.
	Conduct periodic security audits and ensure compliance with data protection regulations.
	Train staff on IT security awareness and safe data handling practices.


User Support &amp; Training:


	Provide technical support to all departments for hardware, software, and network-related issues.
	Maintain a helpdesk system to track and resolve IT support requests efficiently.
	Train staff on new systems, tools, and technology best practices.


IT Strategy &amp; Budgeting:


	Develop and implement IT policies, strategies, and plans that align with the hotel&rsquo;s goals.
	Prepare and manage the IT department&rsquo;s annual budget.
	Evaluate emerging technologies and recommend upgrades to improve operational efficiency and guest service.
	Ensure cost-effective procurement and maintenance of IT equipment and licenses.


Vendor &amp; Contract Management:


	Liaise with IT vendors, internet service providers, and hardware suppliers to ensure optimal service delivery.
	Negotiate service contracts and ensure adherence to agreed SLAs.
	Oversee maintenance contracts and renewals for all IT-related assets.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	B.Sc Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years IT experience, with at least 2 years in a supervisory or managerial role within the hospitality industry.
	Professional certifications such as CCNA, CompTIA, ITIL, or Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE) are an advantage.
	Hands-on experience with PMS (Opera, IDS, or similar), POS, and accounting systems (Sage, Sun Systems, etc.).


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong technical knowledge of networks, servers, databases, and hospitality software.
	Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills.
	Effective leadership and project management capabilities.
	High attention to detail and organizational ability.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Knowledge of cybersecurity and data protection best practices.


Salary
N400,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV in PDF format to:&nbsp;uhrconsultlimited2019@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "title": "Fleet Officer",
  "description": "Matrix Energy Group is a rapidly growing indigenous and integrated Oil Marketing and Trading Company in Nigeria, which was incorporated November 25, 2004.

Over the years, Matrix Energy has grown from a modest supply and distributions operation to a fully integrated petroleum products marketing and trading company with clients and suppliers all over the world.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fleet Officer

Job Opening ID: MEL1149
Job Location:&nbsp;Warri, Delta
Job Type: Full time
Industry: Logistics

Job Description


	The job holder is responsible for all fleet operations processes, such as trip management, fuel administration, driver support, incident escalation, and shortage resolution, are executed effectively and efficiently.
	This role is critical to ensuring that trucks are efficiently managed, drivers are supported in real-time, and fleet operations run smoothly and in compliance with organizational standards.


Responsibilities and Accountabilities


	Open and manage trips for trucks and drivers using the ERP system, ensuring accurate trip details and timely scheduling.
	Ensure that planned trips and revenue targets are achieved in line with the approved operational budget.
	Manage and coordinate third-party truck hires to support operational needs and meet delivery timelines.
	Ensure prompt loading of trucks at loading points and drive compliance with company TAT benchmarks for both outbound and return trips.
	Raise and issue fuel coupons based on approved trip plans and monitor fuel usage against distance and delivery metrics.
	Raise trip allowances based on approved trip rate on ERP for account disbursement.
	Follow up with the Maintenance Team to ensure prompt repair of trucks, particularly those affecting trip schedules or causing downtime.
	Close trips on the ERP system upon delivery completion, ensuring all supporting documents are verified and submitted.
	Collaborate with relevant departments to resolve and collect shortages from or for drivers, ensuring proper documentation and reconciliation of discrepancies.
	Provide real-time assistance to drivers in cases of road challenges, mechanical issues, or delivery complications.
	Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all trips and fuel-related transactions.
	Ensure timely update of ERP systems with trip and driver details.
	Monitor all inbound and outbound truck movements using GPS &amp; fleet management software.
	Maintain journey logs and generate reports on trip performance.
	Prepare daily, weekly and monthly reports to the supervisor on all tasks and ongoing trips.


Requirements


	National Diploma (ND) in Computer Science, Logistics, or a related field.
	Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in logistics, transportation operations or a related role.
	Knowledge of GPS tracking systems, route planning software, and fleet management tools is an added advantage.
	Ability to work safely and efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
	Good time management skills, communication and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work as part of a team.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple trips simultaneously.
	Knowledge of transportation laws, safety regulations, and related compliance requirements is an added advantage.
	Must have the ability to work with and maintain good relationships with colleagues at all levels, including truck drivers and mechanics.
	Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office tools (Word and Excel) will be an added advantage.

Fleet Officer Job at Matrix Energy Group




        
    

        
        Matrix Energy Group is a rapidly growing indigenous and integrated Oil Marketing and Trading Company in Nigeria, which was incorporated November 25, 2004.

Over the years, Matrix Energy has grown from a modest supply and distributions operation to a fully integrated petroleum products marketing and trading company with clients and suppliers all over the world.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fleet Officer

Job Opening ID: MEL1149
Job Location: Warri, Delta
Job Type: Full time
Industry: Logistics

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The job holder is responsible for all fleet operations processes, such as trip management, fuel administration, driver support, incident escalation, and shortage resolution, are executed effectively and efficiently.
	This role is critical to ensuring that trucks are efficiently managed, drivers are supported in real-time, and fleet operations run smoothly and in compliance with organizational standards.


Responsibilities and Accountabilities


	Open and manage trips for trucks and drivers using the ERP system, ensuring accurate trip details and timely scheduling.
	Ensure that planned trips and revenue targets are achieved in line with the approved operational budget.
	Manage and coordinate third-party truck hires to support operational needs and meet delivery timelines.
	Ensure prompt loading of trucks at loading points and drive compliance with company TAT benchmarks for both outbound and return trips.
	Raise and issue fuel coupons based on approved trip plans and monitor fuel usage against distance and delivery metrics.
	Raise trip allowances based on approved trip rate on ERP for account disbursement.
	Follow up with the Maintenance Team to ensure prompt repair of trucks, particularly those affecting trip schedules or causing downtime.
	Close trips on the ERP system upon delivery completion, ensuring all supporting documents are verified and submitted.
	Collaborate with relevant departments to resolve and collect shortages from or for drivers, ensuring proper documentation and reconciliation of discrepancies.
	Provide real-time assistance to drivers in cases of road challenges, mechanical issues, or delivery complications.
	Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all trips and fuel-related transactions.
	Ensure timely update of ERP systems with trip and driver details.
	Monitor all inbound and outbound truck movements using GPS & fleet management software.
	Maintain journey logs and generate reports on trip performance.
	Prepare daily, weekly and monthly reports to the supervisor on all tasks and ongoing trips.


Requirements


	National Diploma (ND) in Computer Science, Logistics, or a related field.
	Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in logistics, transportation operations or a related role.
	Knowledge of GPS tracking systems, route planning software, and fleet management tools is an added advantage.
	Ability to work safely and efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
	Good time management skills, communication and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work as part of a team.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple trips simultaneously.
	Knowledge of transportation laws, safety regulations, and related compliance requirements is an added advantage.
	Must have the ability to work with and maintain good relationships with colleagues at all levels, including truck drivers and mechanics.
	Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office tools (Word and Excel) will be an added advantage.
